Description: Shoulder sherd of North Ionian Late Wild Goat Style black-figured pottery closed vessel, probably an amphora; exterior,white slip: black band at shoulder and neck junction; below, frieze of narrow tongues, some with added red; below, black-figure decoration consisting of possibly lotus leaf with added red and two blobs as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by City Art Gallery and Museum, Bristol. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding the decoration, see British Museum 1888,0601.534.3 (though leaf is not incised).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.006)
